title: nbaR
text: Load example data use variouse functions create NBA plots. 1. bar plot  2. donut plot  3. Combined plot  4. RLI plot  5. NBA bubble plot  6. NBA ggplot theme
code: NBA_example_thr_data <- NBA_example_thr_data   bar_plot <- nba_plot(NBA_example_thr_data,                   `OVERALL types`,                   2:5,                  CHRT = "bar",                  NUM = TRUE,                  LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types",                 SAVE = NULL)  bar_plot NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data   donut_plot <- nba_plot(NBA_example_pro_data,                   `OVERALL types`,                   2:5,                  CHRT = "donut",                  NUM = TRUE,                  LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types",                  GRP = F,                 SAVE = NULL)  donut_plot NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data NBA_example_thr_data <- NBA_example_thr_data NBA_example_comb_data <- NBA_example_comb_data   bar_plot_comb <- nba_plot_comb(                NBA_example_comb_data,                 GROUPS= `OVERALL types`,                 METRIC_COL = metric,                METRICS = c("protection_level", "threat_status"),                 COLS = 3:10,                 CHRT = "bar",                 NUM = FALSE,                LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem",                 SAVE=NULL)  bar_plot_comb NBA_example_RLI_data <- NBA_example_RLI_data   RLI_plot <- nba_plot_RLI(NBA_example_RLI_data,                  Years,                   RLI,                   min,                   max)  RLI_plot NBA_example_bubble_data <- NBA_example_bubble_data    bubble_plot <- nba_plot_bubble(DF = NBA_example_bubble_data,                         GROUP = taxon_group,                        CAT = pressure,                        SUB_CAT = sub_pressure,                         VALUE = perc_concern_under_press,                           SAVE = NULL)                            bubble_plot library(ggplot2) NBA_example_pro_data <- NBA_example_pro_data   gg_plot <- ggplot(NBA_example_pro_data, aes(x = `OVERALL types`, y = `Well Protected`))+   ggplot2::geom_point()+   nba_plot_theme()  gg_plot

title: nbaR
text: Please note designed render html outputs may appear correct vignette examples. 7. Basic table 8. Coloured table 9. gt table theme 10. Threatened ecosystems protection level table
code: tbl <- nba_tbl(NBA_example_pro_data)  tbl library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidyr)  tbl <- NBA_example_pro_data %>%  pivot_longer(2:5, names_to = "protection_level") %>%  nba_tbl_colr(COL = protection_level, HEADER = "Coast") #> Warning: Since gt v0.9.0, the `colors` argument has been deprecated. #> • Please use the `fn` argument instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.  tbl library(gt) library(dplyr)   gt_tbl <- NBA_example_thr_data %>%    gt() %>%    nba_tbl_theme()  gt_tbl thr_pro_tbl <- NBA_example_map_data |> nba_tbl_comb(GROUP = P_EcosysType, THR = threat_status, PRO = protection_level,  FILE = "spatial")  thr_pro_tbl

title: nbaR
text: 11. Basic map Please note modeled maps marine technical report 2018.
code: map <- nba_map(DF = NBA_example_map_data,                GEOM = "vector",                 FILL = protection_level,                 LEGEND = TRUE,                 MOE = TRUE)  map

title: NBA theme package
text: nbaR houses functions enable easy creation standardised graphs, plots maps SANBI’s National Biodiversity Assessment (NBA) content.

title: NBA theme package
text: can install development version nbaR GitHub : can tutorial package using:
code: # if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools") #devtools::install_github("SANBI-NBA/nbaR") # # if (!require("learnr")) install.packages("learnr") # learnr::run_tutorial("nba_package_tutorial", package = "nbaR")

title: NBA theme package
text: package intended use r quarto NBA team assist creation NBA website pages reports. goal functions simplify processes creating plots, tables, maps reports standardise outputs realms.

title: NBA theme package
text: data used read csv’s, excel documents, sql (created within r). data structure accepted functions explained help files function. also number example datasets help users understand visually see required data structure. Please refer help files vignettes example datasets. extra columns problem functions mostly bulit ability select columns wish use function. Along example datasets list possible names used categories columns (NBA_categories), please pay attention spelling cases functions case sensitive. categories examples ‘Well Protected’ ‘Least Concern’, used assign correct colours correct categories.

title: NBA theme package
text: find issues package functions, suggestions improvements package please go git repository log issue can dealt .

title: NBA theme package
text: can cite package like “tables figures produced using nbaR R package (Besseling et al., 2024)”. full bibliographic reference include reference list (don’t forget update ‘last accessed’ date): cite package ‘nbaR’ publications use: Besseling N, Bull L, Monyeki M, Hendricks S, von Staden L (2024). “Package creation NBA.” NA, 1(1), 1. doi:10.5281/zenodo.15310061 https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15310061. title: NBA map function — nba_map
text: NBA maps protection level, threat status, condition. function can take dataset either one polygon multipolygon per ecosystem (row unique ecosystem) multiple rows per ecosystem type.

title: NBA map function — nba_map
code: nba_map(   DF,   GEOM = c("vector", "raster"),   FILL,   LEGEND = FALSE,   MOE = FALSE,   LWD = 0.1,   SCALE_TEXT = 1 )

title: NBA map function — nba_map
text: DF data frame contains information GEOM Whether layer vector raster. Vectors must sf objects rasters must terra (spatraster) objects FILL column contains categories colour ecosystems (e.g. protection level, threat status, condition) LEGEND True include legend plot, False exclude MOE True include Map orientation elements (MOE) scale bar north arrow, False exclude LWD Line width use plot SCALE_TEXT scale sizes plot text fit intended output. currently set 1 default. want save 8 6 cm, set 0.5.

title: NBA map function — nba_map
text: Returns map

title: NBA map function — nba_map
text: function expects sf object. Please look example data NBA_example_map_data see correct structure data. name fill column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named nbaR::NBA_categories package, can accessed reference).

title: NBA map function — nba_map
code: map <- nba_map(DF = NBA_example_map_data, GEOM = "vector", FILL = protection_level, LEGEND = TRUE, MOE = TRUE)  map

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
text: function create horizontal bar plots donut plots. function expects coloumn groups (e.g. ecosystem function groups, taxa etc), one group value per row, several columns protection level, threat status, condition groups values representing either number percentage/ extent groups within category. columns named according conventions nbaR::NBA_categories example list.

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
code: nba_plot(   DF,   GROUPS,   COLS,   CHRT = c("bar", "donut"),   NUM = FALSE,   LAB,   GRP = FALSE,   SAVE = NULL,   SCALE_TEXT = 1 )

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
text: DF data frame contains information GROUPS categorized variables (ecosystem functional group, taxa, etc) COLS categories describe variables (protection level, threat status, condition, etc). can use tidyselect method select columns e.g. 2:4/ Endangered:Vulnerable/ c(Well Protected,Moderately Protected,Poorly Protected,Protected) etc CHRT choice either "bar" "donut" plot NUM choice show numbers plot, False show numbers LAB x axis label plot GRP choice whether plot donut graphs group, TRUE plot donut plot group. SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one. SCALE_TEXT scale sizes plot text fit intended output. currently set 1 default. want save 8 6 cm, set 0.5.

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
text: Returns plot

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
text: Please look example datasets NBA_example_thr_plot NBA_example_pro_plot see correct structure data. Please note datasets structure, whether used make bar donut plot irrelevant. function plot data either bar donut plot depending require. can also decide want donut plot split ecosystem functional group (e.g one donut plot per functional group) choose ifyou want number ecosystems displayed within plot. name groups column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named nbaR::NBA_categories package, can accessed reference).

title: NBA plot function — nba_plot
code: bar_plot <- nba_plot(NBA_example_thr_data, `OVERALL types`, 2:5, CHRT = "bar", NUM = TRUE, LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types", SAVE = NULL) #> Warning: Arguments in `...` must be used. #> ✖ Problematic argument: #> • size = 0.5 * SCALE_TEXT #> ℹ Did you misspell an argument name?  bar_plot #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text()`).   donut_plot <- nba_plot(NBA_example_pro_data, `OVERALL types`, 2:5, CHRT = "donut", NUM = TRUE, LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem types", GRP = FALSE, SAVE = NULL)  donut_plot

what: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
text: function create line graph indicating Red list index per period/year. Additionally, depending graph requirements creates multiple line graph grouping plot according species, creates buffer parallel RLI line using minimum maximum values.

title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
code: nba_plot_RLI(   DF,   YEAR,   RLI,   MIN,   MAX,   GROUP = NULL,   summarise_by_year = TRUE,   SAVE = NULL )

title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
text: DF data frame contains information Red List Index YEAR years RLI Red List Index MIN minimum values MAX maximum values GROUP choice group plot, column name supplied groupd, left NULL group summarise_by_year must added SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one.

title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
text: Returns RLI plot

title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
text: Note: graph can used datasets well, long contains data structure Red List Index. example dataset (NBA_example_RLI_data), available users reference needed.

title: NBA Redlist index plot function — nba_plot_RLI
code: #RLI_plot <- nba_plot_RLI(NBA_example_RLI_data, #Years, #RLI, #MIN, #MAX)  #RLI_plot

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
text: function create bubble plot intended creation percentage taxa ecological concern impacted various pressures

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
code: nba_plot_bubble(DF, GROUP, CAT, SUB_CAT, VALUE, SAVE = NULL)

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
text: DF data frame contains information GROUP grouping variables (taxa group, etc) CAT overall pressure category SUB_CAT sub pressure category VALUE percentage taxa ecological concern impacted pressure SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one.

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
text: Returns bubble plot

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
text: Please use example dataset NBA_bubble_plot_example_data see data formatted.

title: Bubble plot — nba_plot_bubble
code: bubble_plot <- nba_plot_bubble(DF = NBA_example_bubble_data,                         GROUP = taxon_group,                        CAT = pressure,                        SUB_CAT = sub_pressure,                        VALUE = perc_concern_under_press,                         SAVE = NULL) #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the nbaR package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/TashBes/NBA.package/issues>.  bubble_plot #> Warning: Removed 41 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 41 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text()`).

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
text: function plot multiple plots created NBA_plot function one grid.

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
code: nba_plot_comb(   DF,   GROUPS,   METRIC_COL,   METRICS,   COLS,   CHRT = c("bar", "donut"),   NUM = FALSE,   LAB,   GRP = FALSE,   SAVE = NULL )

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
text: DF data frame contains information GROUPS categorized variables (ecosystem functional group, taxa, etc) METRIC_COL column differentiates rows belong plots METRICS list identifiers plot COLS categories describe variables (protection level, threat status, condition, etc). can use tidyselect method select columns e.g. 2:4/ Endangered:Vulnerable/ c(Well Protected,Moderately Protected,Poorly Protected,Protected) etc CHRT choice either "bar" "donut" plot NUM choice show numbers plot, False show numbers LAB x axis label plot GRP choice whether plot donut graphs group, TRUE plot donut plot group. SAVE name output file saved output folder. outputs folder prompted make one.

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
text: Returns plot

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
text: function expects groups column, one group per row, protection level, threat status, condition categories headings column well column identify rows plotted together (.e rows represent extent represent number). Please look example data NBA_example_comb_data see correct structure data. Please note whether used make bar donut plot irrelevant. name groups column irrelevant, categories must spelled correctly (list standard spellings/ cases NBA categories named nbaR::NBA_categories package, can accessed reference). nameing plots automatically alphabetical lower case. ordering plots also automatic. legend assumed added bottom plots.

title: NBA multi plot function — nba_plot_comb
code: bar_plot_comb <- nba_plot_comb( NBA_example_comb_data, GROUPS= `OVERALL types`, METRIC_COL = metric, METRICS = c("protection_level", "threat_status"), COLS = 3:10, CHRT = "bar", NUM = FALSE, LAB = "Percentage of ecosystem", SAVE=NULL) #> Warning: Arguments in `...` must be used. #> ✖ Problematic argument: #> • size = 0.5 * SCALE_TEXT #> ℹ Did you misspell an argument name? #> Warning: Arguments in `...` must be used. #> ✖ Problematic argument: #> • size = 0.5 * SCALE_TEXT #> ℹ Did you misspell an argument name? #> Warning: Removed 32 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`). #> Warning: Removed 32 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`). #> Warning: Removed 32 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`).  bar_plot_comb  #

text: Copies template files project directory.

title: Create template quarto documents to get an NBA html page up and running — nba_init_quarto_docs
code: nba_init_quarto_docs(   path = ".",   overwrite = FALSE,   files = c("_brand.yml", "_quarto.yml", "custom.scss", "sanbi.csl",     "_title-meta-author.html", "title-metadata.html", "scientific.qmd", "basic.qmd",     "references.bib"),   rename = NULL )

title: Create template quarto documents to get an NBA html page up and running — nba_init_quarto_docs
text: path destination directory. Defaults current working directory. Just add name folder want documents cpoied long project folder. overwrite Whether overwrite existing files. Defaults FALSE. files Character vector files copy. Defaults template files. rename Named character vector rename files copy, e.g., c("scientific.qmd" = "index.qmd")

title: Create template quarto documents to get an NBA html page up and running — nba_init_quarto_docs
text: Invisibly returns paths copied files.

title: Create template quarto project to get an NBA html page up and running — nba_init_quarto_proj

title: Create template quarto project to get an NBA html page up and running — nba_init_quarto_proj
text: path destination directory project, project automatically names templates overwrite Whether overwrite existing files. Defaults FALSE. rename Named character vector rename files copy, e.g., c("scientific.qmd" = "index.qmd")
